intro: Otonychium retusum, commonly known as the rough otonychium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and somewhat hairy, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Otonychium retusum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
